titles: A conscionable couple, or, The valiant resolution of a young-man and a maid, that have left all their kindred, as true folks have said: twas for their religion and good conscience sake, that they forsook England, a voyage to take. These two loving Protestants kindly together, are gone to seek fortunes, there's no man knows whither. To a curious new tune, or, The faithful friend.
publisher: Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, J. Wright, and J. Clark.,
notes: Date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "This doth make the world to wonde[r] ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
